resources.string: Search by case name or modules
Case 1. When you open this screen, the keyboard are immediately shown and EditText view below has focus. Use button on the right side to defocus view and hide keyboard

Case 2. Use Show button to show keybord, but EditText view on the center will not have focus. Use Hide button to hide keyboard. If EditText view will have focus and you will use Hide button, keyboard will be hidden, but EditText will have focus
Case 1: Add number in EditText view below, and format number to formated input using Format button
Case 2: Add number in EditText view below, and format it to formated string using Format button
Case 3: Add something in EditText view below, and get only numbers from string you added using Get numbers button
Case 4: Luhn algorithm check. This only works if you are certain all input will be at least 10 characters
Case 5: Add card number and get card type using Card type button

Switch manager from the Util module is created for handling enabling and disabling views. With the first custom switcher you can enable/disable views using the basic SwitchManager from the module, with the second one you can do the same but with the overridden SwitchManager.
Base SwitchManager can enable/disable view if it implements ISwitchView interface or if it is an EditText
Custom SwitchManager overriding base SwitchManager and also can enable/disable view if it is a Button ot SwitchMaterial
Before become isChecked switcher checks for a non-empty field below. Enter something in the input field and turn on the switcher
Use this switcher for enabling and disabling views on the screen. Switcher is on - enable views, off - disable
Create your own CustomSwitcher. Use functional below to add characteristics and style to your view.
Use this switcher to enable/disable views on the screen
Case 1: Listheader view with title, icon on the right and ListOpenedListener. Click on container to open/close list below
Case 2: Listheader view without title, icon on the right is clickable
Case 3: Listheader view with title, clickable action text on the right and clickable container
Case 1. Topbar without any icons, but with divider
Case 3. Topbar with navigation icon and actionView on the right, with handler for handling clicks
Case 4. Topbar with action icon on the right
Case 5. Topbar with actionView on the left
Case 6. Topbar with actionView on the left and actionIcon on the right. Use button below to change title, actionView and action icon, with handler for handling clicks
Case 7. Topbar with actionViews. Use button below to change style of topbar
Case 8. Topbar with actionView on the right
Case 9. Topbar with two icons and two actionViews, but icons are not visible cause actionViews are in priority, with handler for handling clicks
Case 10. Topbar with two icons, with handler for handling clicks
Case 1. Card with icons, cardValueAlignment inherit, two dividers, all paddings and default title width percent
Case 2. Card with end icon, cardValueAlignment center, two dividers, text style and title width percent 0.1
Case 3. Card value without title, icons, top divider and with long text, cardValueAlignment textEnd
Case 4. Just title with long text, no dividers
Case 5. Card value with fixed height, dividers and all parts have different vertical bias. You can use button below to change cardline style
Case 1: Pin view with a base style. Use button below to add/restore pin items or clear all added pins.
Case 2: Pin view with a custom style. Use button below to add/restore pin items or clear all added pins.
